description: Retrospective application for change of use to include car sales
decision_conditions: Condition : 1 - The proposed development shall be carried out in all respects in accordance with the proposals contained in the application and the approved plans and documents (Design, Access and Planning Statement by Paul Dickinson and Associates; BS4142 Assessment by KP Acoustics Ltd; Revised Transport Statement by Transport and Traffic Consultancy (received on 18 September 2020); Delivery and Servicing Management Plan Statement by Transport and Traffic Consultancy; DWG 953A/RDP/P01 Rev. A; broxap wardale cycle shelter specification sheet (received on 01 May 2020)) therewith and approved by the Local Planning Authority, or as shall have been otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority before the building is used.
Condition : 2 - The car sales business is to operate only between the hours of 10:00am and 6:00pm Monday to Saturday and 11:00am to 4:00pm on Sundays and Bank Holidays.

Condition : 3 - The car parking spaces shown on the approved plans shall be used only by cars that are for sale or for customers of the car sales business. At no time shall any spaces be leased, sold or used for any other purpose without the prior written permission of the Council.

Condition : 4 - Within three months of the date of this permission the staff facilities (including lockers, tea room and shower) are to all be fully implemented and shall thereafter be retained as such

Condition : 5 - Within three months of the date of this permission, a Delivery and Servicing Management Plan (DSMP) shall have been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The DSMP shall outline how cars are delivered, how frequently they are delivered, and at what hours the deliveries take place. It shall include hours that servicing takes place. It shall include a commitment that all servicing, loading and unloading of vehicles will take place wholly within the confines of the site. The development shall thereafter not be carried out otherwise than in accordance with the approved details and shall be maintained for the lifetime of the development, unless the prior written approval of the local planning authority is obtained to any variation

Condition : 6 - Within three months of the date of this permission a Car Parking Management Plan shall have been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The Parking Management Plan shall outline how the proposed car sales spaces and customer parking will be operated, managed and enforced. The plan should detail and include a commitment to prevent the spaces being occupied by any vehicle other than one that is currently for sale. Thereafter the development shall not be carried out otherwise than in accordance with the approved details and shall be maintained for the lifetime of the development, unless the prior written approval of the local planning authority is obtained to any variation
